summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, primarily alleging widespread SEC corruption, obstruction of justice, and facilitation of financial fraud. The emails detail claims of illegal naked short selling, money laundering through OTC market shells, and specific allegations involving companies like Kodak (KODK), Virtu Financial (NITE), and Blink Charging (BLNK), while implicating figures connected to Jeffrey Epstein, Donald Trump, and private equity firms like Blackstone.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, financial fraud, and money laundering related to Knight Capital, Virtu Financial, and various OTC shell companies.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: Primary recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused of failing to distribute his information and obstructing investigations.

persons.name: Schwarzman
persons.context: Described as being on the SEC's 'do not investigate' list, connected to Kodak fraud, Trump, Kushner, and Epstein.

persons.name: Jason New
persons.context: Named as a Blackstone representative on the Kodak board, involved in the internal investigation of Kodak's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Dick Best
persons.context: Recently promoted SEC official, previously at FINRA. Accused by Dilorio of potentially obstructing investigations related to his TCR.

persons.name: Lara Shalov Mehraban
persons.context: Accused of having a conflict of interest due to a former colleague/boss relationship with Virtu Financial's Doug Cifu and obstructing investigations.

persons.name: Doug Cifu
persons.context: Referred to as 'Dougie Large', former colleague of Lara Mehraban at Paul Weiss. Alleged to be running the 'criminal entity' NITE (Virtu's market-making arm).

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: Accused of having undisclosed conflicts due to his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell's representation of Knight/Virtu and of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Named as a key figure in keeping the 'criminal entity' NITE/Virtu operational, linked to Jay Clayton.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Board Member of Virtu Financial and FSD Pharma
persons.context: Former Trump campaign manager, serves on the board of NITE and a pot company accused of being a money laundering shell.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.role: CEO of Blink Charging, Bag Man
persons.context: Alleged 'prolific Bag Man' involved with money laundering shells like SkyWay and Blink Charging (BLNK), linked to Trump fundraisers and Epstein.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Named as a Trump fundraiser and Epstein business partner, related to Michael Farkas.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch, mentioned in connection with Blink Charging.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having business and social connections to Schwarzman, Jonathan Farkas, and Bill Richardson.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Described as 'Pumper/Grifter in Chief', connected to Schwarzman, Kushner, and alleged pump-and-dump schemes involving Kodak.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused alongside Janey of obstruction and corruption.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged fraudster involved with convertible note schemes and money laundering shells like NewLead and FreeSeas.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged fraudster barred by FINRA but still active in 2019 with Blink Charging, accused of money laundering.

persons.name: Alex Ioffe
persons.context: Former CFO of Interactive Brokers (IBKR), hired by Doug Cifu at Virtu. Implicated in SAR filing failures.

persons.name: Sean P. Galvin
persons.context: Certified financials for KCG after the previous CFO resigned, linked to the alleged fraud.

connections.description: Dilorio is the whistleblower sending extensive allegations of fraud and obstruction to SEC official Janey, whom he accuses of failing to act.
Described as 'BFF's' (best friends forever). Schwarzman is also connected to Kushner and Epstein.
Mentioned as being connected to Epstein.
Alleged former colleague/boss relationship at law firm Paul Weiss. Dilorio implies this creates a conflict of interest in her SEC investigations of Virtu.
Colleagues at law firm Sullivan & Cromwell. Both are accused of facilitating the ongoing fraud at NITE/Virtu.
Urban was Trump's Pennsylvania campaign manager.
Implied to be related. Both are involved in fundraising and alleged financial schemes.
Described as a business partner of Jeffrey Epstein.
Linked to Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch.
Both are described as 'Bag Men' involved in similar schemes involving money laundering shells and convertible notes.

events.title: Phlow Corporation Awarded $354M Government Contract
events.description: Phlow Corporation, linked to Kodak, receives a $354 million HHS/ASPR/BARDA contract to manufacture essential medicines, including hydroxychloroquine.

events.title: Kodak Signs Letter of Intent with Phlow
events.description: Kodak signs a Letter of Intent with Phlow Corporation to show it had a customer for its future Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs), as part of its DFC loan application.

events.title: Blink Charging (BLNK) Pump on PR
events.description: Blink Charging issues a press release about a grant for charging stations, causing the stock to rise 27% on high volume. Dilorio alleges this was a fraudulent pump-and-dump with no required SEC 8-K filing.

events.title: Virtu Financial (NITE) Reports Q2 2020 Receivable
events.description: Virtu Financial reports a receivable of $2.44 billion for Q2 2020, which Dilorio alleges is fraudulent accounting for naked short fails, indicating ongoing insolvency.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: The August 1, 2012, trading glitch at Knight Capital Group that caused massive losses. Dilorio alleges it was orchestrated with help from Blackstone, JEF, GS, and the SEC.

events.title: SEC Charges UBS with AML Violations
events.description: The SEC charges UBS Financial Services Inc. with failing to report suspicious transactions, resulting in a $5 million penalty. Dilorio claims this case is based on his information.

locations: Washington (state) - Mentioned for Mullen EV production
New Mexico (Zorro Ranch) - Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Bill Richardson
14 Wall Street, New York - Address linked to Oleg Firer's Acies Corp
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, alleges the SEC is a 'criminal organization' that actively obstructs investigations, protects financial criminals, and facilitates massive fraud on the public while denying whistleblower awards.

Dilorio's core allegation is that Virtu Financial's market-making arm (NITE) is a 'criminal entity' whose core business is abusive naked short selling of OTC shell companies to facilitate money laundering, and that the SEC enables this through inaction and the DTCC's Obligation Warehouse.

Specific companies implicated in alleged fraud schemes include Eastman Kodak (KODK), Virtu Financial (VIRT/NITE), Blink Charging (BLNK), Net Element (NETE), and various OTC shells, with ties to private equity (Blackstone), political figures (Trump, Kushner), and Jeffrey Epstein associates.

The emails claim SEC officials, including Jane Norberg (Janey), Lara Mehraban, and Chairman Jay Clayton, have conflicts of interest and have criminally obstructed investigations into Dilorio's claims for years.
Dilorio references connections between alleged financial fraud actors and Jeffrey Epstein, including Schwarzman (Blackstone), Jonathan Farkas (Trump fundraiser), and former Governor Bill Richardson.
